job_description:
Step into Haworth, where marketing is our passion, and paid media is our playground.

The + in our full name – Haworth Marketing + Media – symbolizes our unique blend of media expertise and marketing ingenuity. Haworth is a marketing-led, creative-driven, digital-first modern media agency. We value the individuality and independence of our employee shareholders – and with our 50-year history of integrity as a cornerstone, we’ve cultivated authentic partnerships with an impressive roster of clients.

Headquartered in Minneapolis with a nationwide network of remote workers, Haworth fosters a dynamic, inclusive environment where individuality thrives. Our casual atmosphere and hybrid work model is filled with thinkers, doers, and overachievers. Haworthians are hard-working individuals who thrive on challenging the norms, driven by a passion for delivering exceptional client work and making a positive impact on our communities.

Haworth's suite of services is crafted to meet the evolving needs of today’s clients. Join us in shaping businesses and leveraging our services to create impactful growth strategies together.

PARTNERSHIP (NEW BUSINESS) DEVELOPMENT DIRECTOR

The Partnership Development Director is a critical part of our agency growth roadmap. This position is accountable for stewarding Haworth teams through growth initiatives aligned to the company’s best opportunities. The scope of work includes creating relationships with top-tier marketers, stewarding RFPs and pitch development.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Responding to and creating new business leads
• Define lead generation outreach plan to ensure quality leads are acquired (SEM, Events, partner agencies, C-suite relationships, etc.)
• Source agency introduction meetings and lead development of presentation materials
• Evaluate and respond to incoming opportunities sourced from professional agency recruitment services and consultants
• Collaborate closely with leadership to tailor and refine outbound narrative based on each audience

RFI & RFP Stewardship & Development
• Collaborate with internal stakeholders to respond to RFI and RFP submissions
• Steward entire RFP process with confidence and a bold perspective
• Lead strategy and planning solutions when a deliverable is part of the RFP
• Utilize media partnerships to bolster value propositions and strengthen RFP submissions
• Manage new partner procurement end-to-end and transition wins to the working team

External Reputation Development
• Identify relevant events & experiences to market Haworth to prospective clients and employees; represent our company well and generate awareness of Haworth services
• Attend select events and networking opportunities to represent Haworth
• Participate in panel discussions or similar speaking opportunities
• Own and steward Haworth social media content strategy & execution along with supporting team
• Present and explain Haworth services, positioning, and sales approach to internal staff, fostering a comprehensive understanding and alignment across the agency

REQUIREMENTS
• Entrepreneurial mindset
• Unpretentiously exude confidence instilling trust and credibility
• Curious, inventive, collaborative spirit
• Ability to manage, captivate and inspire
• Comfortably command attention, adept at engaging audiences to deliver impactful presentations
• Thrive working in high-pressure situations
• Self-motivated, ability to prioritize workloads, and solution-oriented
• Superior written & verbal communication skills to facilitate clear and persuasive expression of ideas
• Proven ability to develop/maintain strong professional relationships with clients/colleagues/vendors
• Demonstrated expertise developing integrated marketing communication plans, incorporating both traditional and non-traditional media strategies
• Confidently leverage big data sets to inform and shape strategies & plans

EXPERIENCE
• At least 3 years participating in growth initiatives and sales in media and/or marketing technology, demonstrating a solid understanding of industry dynamics
• 8+ years of experience in media planning including a minimum of 3-5 years in a managerial capacity
• Understanding of agency services and a POV on Haworth’s differentiation on social & digital media
• Fluent in holistic media planning (i.e. aware of research tools, capabilities in media, etc.)
• Proven track record of thought leadership and innovation in media, ideally in agency transformation, underscoring a capacity for driving change and staying ahead of industry trends

Competitive compensation and casual, team-oriented working environment. Qualified candidates in remote locations considered. Please forward your resume and salary requirements to: hr@haworthmedia.com
